intro: Romulea minima, commonly known as the dwarf romulea, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and crocuses. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and small size, Romulea minima is considered a rare and delicate species.
